intro: Kohautia caespitosa var. schimperi, commonly known as the Schimperi's kohautia, is a species of flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
